page.title: 16 North Baddesley Church
page.content:
{ St. John The Baptist} The oldest part of the church, which dates from Norman Times, is the North side. Inside the Rood Screen separates the Altar from the people.
In the big church chest the vestments are kept. Behind the memorial for the Chamberlaine family there are four angels carved into the wall. The font is by the door. It is made from stone.
On the wall is the coat of arms of George III. In 1760 it was used as a chicken coop door.
In the graveyard Charles Smith, a poacher, has two headstones. One laid by friends and one laid by the landowner. There is also the gravestone of a man who supposidly fell out of the tower.
